On avait pas prevu sa mais la rose a finit par fanee
On brillait pourtant autant que le reflet du soleil
L'avenir nous le disait on se letait promis 
Mais le diable pactisait pour qutu dorme ds son lit 
Jai chercher des solutions pour rattraper le diamant que jai laisser dans tes mains 
Le respect dnos traditions nous a pousser vers des chemins differents 
Le seul romantisme que j'ai eu c'est lrevers d'une hache plein dsang
Ya plus de mots doux quand il s'agit d'etre seul , puisque les destins sont tranchants
La rose noircit par le sol meme si les racines prennent l'eau 
Elle manquait peut etre de sincerite envers elle meme et son nom
Et si les aveugles preferent regarder vers le bas 
Sache que j'ai regarder droit devant 
Ta preferer en choisir un dans le tas 
Et je sais que j'ai perdu du temps 
L'avoeu de faiblesse c'est dtavoir fait confiance 
On l'etait au plus haut rang quil soit

text: I'm so glad G- Nation let us all attend their concert, aren't y'all? I swear, watching their audition really felt like I was watching a group in concert. And, I always thought that dude, who sings "When Doves Cry" while looping the sound, and the music, makes that song, which I love anyway, sound really cool. There aren't enough words for me to describe Karis Eden's talent. And this guy, with the growling baritone, who sings "Sound of Silence" is simply enthralling, with that unique voice. I'd like to go on, and comment on how great the others are, too. But there are just too many really fantastic singers on this video to be able to do that. And no, I can't pick just one of them, as being my favorite one. They're all very different from each other, and I like listening to them sing for different reasons. So that's impossible for me to do. Sorry. For me, each singer I choose to listen to is my favorite singer, while I'm listening to them. I really think that's how it should be. Don't you?

text:
I realize this song is about a man and a woman in a relationship and their struggles.
I look at it as a cancer song.  My mothers cancer song. Round and round we go is the chemo and radiation and being “cured” 3 times only for the cancer to come back 4 times over 12 years 
She lost her battle on June 6, 2019.
I cry every time I hear this song because I miss her so much
Thank you for this song from this 58 Canadian male. This song will be with me forever.
